Hi, @felixcheung , This is a good question. https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/3387#pullrequestreview-253086774
1. server #1 renames a note
2. server #2 deletes the same note

If rename is effective, the deletion will fail.
If you delete the gentleman, then rename will fail.

@felixcheung , Thank you for asking this question. :-)
I think that implementing atomicity in a distributed system is a big issue.
I think, after the distributed features of zeppelin go online, After zeppelin has more user groups, Think about it again. Are you saying ok?
Zeppelin's distributed clustering model is used by a large number of analysts in our company every day. There have been no cases where different analysts are working on the same note. 
Because notes are generally not only shared with members of the group. There won't be many users working on the same note at the same time.

Folks, This PR is ready for review. Now scala 2.12 is supported.

Only need one image file, There is no need to deploy a spark environment on a zeppelin server.
`https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/master/scripts/docker/interpreter/Dockerfile`

Thanks for the contribution @sergeymazin , does this new pattern also apply to livy 0.5 ?
Will merge if no more comments

@zjffdu yes,
regular expression matches both response strings: `"Session '3449' not found."` for Livy <=0.5 and `{"msg":"Session '3449' not found."}` for Livy 0.6.

Related change in Livy codebase: https://github.com/apache/incubator-livy/pull/127

Can this change be also pushed to Zeppelin 0.8 branch as stability fix?

@zjffdu

BTW, another thing I am thinking about is the integration test of Cluster Manager. Maybe we could simulate that by starting 2 zeppelin server in one machine.

I added a few test cases that can run several nodes on a server to create a zeppelin cluster. They are

### One zeppelin-sever + Two ClusterManagerServer -> Compose a zeppelin cluster
> Can simulate cluster events for zeppelin clusters.

https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/master/zeppelin-server/src/test/java/org/apache/zeppelin/cluster/ClusterEventTest.java

### One or Three ClusterManagerServer -> Compose a zeppelin cluster
> Metadata test used to check the cluster itself.

https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/master/zeppelin-interpreter/src/test/java/org/apache/zeppelin/cluster/ClusterMultiNodeTest.java

https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/master/zeppelin-interpreter/src/test/java/org/apache/zeppelin/cluster/ClusterSingleNodeTest.java

I reopened. #3404

> I thought source to inherent the environment from the current one?

@felixcheung, Sorry but I didn't understand your question.

Without `PYTHONPATH` in `zeppelin-env.sh` and before this patch, 
pyspark can run without impersonate setting but with impersonate, pyspark cannot run.

Because PYTHONPATH is made by `interpreter.sh`
but when impersonate is on, PYTHONPATH wasn't exist each system account so spark-submit cann't use `PYTHONPATH`.

`ZEPPELIN_HOME` also be not passed. but I think that it can be important information for something because it is base path.
Ok, I updated PR comment https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/3403#issue-297074981.

>

> .
>

@srehmann , Very welcome to contribute your code, boldly try, we will help you. :-)

> I have made all the changes, and ready to commit. Just wanted a clarification on the title thing. You meant commit title or what?
1. The title of the PR is generally the title of the ticket. 
    PR title => `[ZEPPELIN-3065] Personalized mode does not allow multiple users to run the same paragraph at the same time`

2. If the title is too long, you can abbreviate it.
PR title => `[ZEPPELIN-3065] Personalized mode can't run multiple people at the same time`

so, Please change PR title to `[ZEPPELIN-3065] Personalized mode can't run multiple people at the same time`

> Moreover, when I will commit the reviews changes, what should be the commit message then?
+ I added a note to the comment.

@srehmann ,  You can follow my Comments, Modify the code in your IDEA, After modifying the code,
Committed by `git commit`, The PR here will display your modified code.
@liuxunorg I have done the changes and committed.

@srehmann , The branch code you develop needs to be kept at the top of all commit records.
Now your branch, because there is no rebase to the top, is currently unable to submit.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3677382/61920183-4be31900-af8b-11e9-9a69-cb60cbac2c77.png)

1. You need to save your modified code as a patch file.
2. To clean up your branch again, first make your branch and /apach/zeppelin commit records consistent, then apply your patch file and resubmit.

If you don't do the above, then you can:
1. Save your own modified code.
2. Re-create a new branch on the latest master branch;
3. On the new branch, modify the code;
4. Re-pull this new branch;

Before committing the code in the future, you have to execute it to ensure that your code branch is the top layer so that you can merge it.
```
git rebase upstream/master
```

Don't be discouraged, familiar with git operations, there will be no problems in the future. :-)
@srehmann You can close this PR and create another PR

@srehmann , Thank you for your contribution. :-)

Please change 

> What is this PR for?
> [ZEPPELIN-3065] Personalized mode does not allow multiple users to run the same paragraph at the same time

to description in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZEPPELIN-3065

E.g, 

> What is this PR for?
> In personalized mode, if user A is running a paragraph and user B starts running the paragraph before user A's run has completed then user A's paragraph will remain stuck in the "running" state. Furthermore, all messages from user B's run be appended to the output for user A.
Description updated :)
Do i need to do something or wait for the ci cycle completion?

You only need to wait for the end of the CI, and then paste the address of your PR CI in the content of the PR.
You can refer to my PR: https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/3407

If the test case reported in the CI did not pass, you need to check the cause of the error. Generally there are the following situations:
1. If it is not caused by your code, you can repeat the failed test items in travis, sometimes more than a few times, to pass.
2. If it is a problem caused by your code, then you need to solve it.
3. If you add new features, you need to add the corresponding test cases to protect and verify your code, avoid the code you add, and be modified by others later.

Although it seems that these are a bit of a hassle, I believe it will help you with your programming.
We need a little patience. :-)

In addition, due to the release of the new version of the latest mysql, there are some test cases in travis-ci, can not pass, we have contacted the mysql community, need to wait for the solution, in order to pass travis-ci.
So, your current travis ci may fail, you can pay attention to the zeppelin community's mail, and the travis ci will return to normal, there will be an email notification. At that time, you need to re-execute travis ci and then update the travis address in the PR.

> In addition, due to the release of the new version of the latest mysql, there are some test cases in travis-ci, can not pass, we have contacted the mysql community, need to wait for the solution, in order to pass travis-ci.
> So, your current travis ci may fail, you can pay attention to the zeppelin community's mail, and the travis ci will return to normal, there will be an email notification. At that time, you need to re-execute travis ci and then update the travis address in the PR.

Yup. I can see from the logs that there's some mysql issue, not related to the fix I did. I will be waiting till the issue is resolved between travis and mysql :)

Once tests are passed, I will update CI address in the PR.

Thanks a lot @liuxunorg
Thanks for the contribution @Byeol Could you add one line of comment so that it will be easier for others to understand it when reading zeppelin code.

@srehmann 
The travis problem has been solved, you can execute the following command
```
git fetch upstream
git checkout ZP3065
git rebase upstream/master
git push -f origin ZP3065:ZP3065
```
Rebase your branch to the latest code base.
Wait for travis to pass and resubmit your code.

@srehmann 
However, I think, Can you add a corresponding test case to ensure the correctness of your code?

There are a lot of test cases in zeppelin. You can find code that is similar to yours. Change to a test case that meets your requirements.
I know to add test cases, There may be a little trouble, But this will ensure the correctness of your code. And can let others not destroy your code.
Can you try adding test cases?

> @srehmann
> The travis problem has been solved, you can execute the following command
> 
> ```
> git fetch upstream
> git checkout ZP3065
> git rebase upstream/master
> git push -f origin ZP3065:ZP3065
> ```
> 
> Rebase your branch to the latest code base.
> Wait for travis to pass and resubmit your code.

Done.
